review_title: Be very careful who you trust
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Falls Church, VA
pros: Fairfax is a gorgeous hospital with a lot of really good staff. It really is world class healthcare and I would take my family there over any other hospital, anywhere. Most of the clinical and support staff are fabulous and work well together. The benefits are decent, the scholarship and tuition assistance is great, and the PTO and holidays are fair (if you can actually use your PTO).
cons: Although the nursing staff and the experience (if I were to be a patient) would be very positive, actually working there and seeing what happens behind the scenes is a whole other story. The middle management is truly toxic and really do promote cliques or "popular people" who are usually toxic, themselves. There is no support for "unpopular" staff who are feeling targeted and the poisonous venom seems to infiltrate behind the scenes and up the chain. HR does not work for you, they work with the middle managers like mean school kids bullying someone on the bus. Any promises or guarantees of confidentiality are absolutely not true. Any internal complaints are laughed at or dismissed. When there is that environment, it is very difficult to trust anything, or anyone. I worked there a long time and things did change dramatically when Steve Narang came. I truly hope he doesn't know or tolerate the behavior of his juvenile middle managers or HR. They are a disgrace.

job_title: Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) in Fairfax, VA
pros: The pay is low for the work we do but high compared to other hospitals (as far as I know). You work 3 12 hour shifts a week (7 am-7pm, 11 am-11 pm, 3:30 pm-3:30 am, or 7 pm-7am). You pick what days/hours you work which is extremely convenient. Staffing is decent to the point where staff are often given the option to go home early with the additional option of using their pto to fill in the missing hours. Lots of bonus shifts with an additional $250 bonus if you pick it up.
cons: Overall the base pay is extremely low for the work done. I’ve been assaulted/threatened by patients on multiple occasions as have many coworkers. The environment is pretty dirty and hectic due to the number of patients we see daily. Patients are often rude or disrespectful because of issues out of our control. If the pay was increased and the department was expanded to properly treat the number of patients we have I would give it 4-5 stars.

job_title: Vice President in Fairfax, VA
pros: Inova is exceptional at patient care. As a mission-driven focus, there is great innovation and attention to building an integrated approach to healthcare. CEO and C-suite and clinical leaders are very accessible to all levels and is very present with staff. Significant ongoing investments in people. Seeing behind the curtain, would definitely only go to Inova for my own and family's medical services - they are simply the best.
cons: Highly matrix and confusing chain of command, decision making. Administrative functions outside of patient care do not have a seat at the table - valued for largely for reactive response, Don't expect to be in the know if you are not in a patient care department. Senior leadership is very paternalistic and starting to blur edges of advocacy into areas of staff's personal life. Recent expansive requirements over vaccines and religious exemptions have polarized what had been building to be a great, inclusive culture. Stale, outdated approach to technology (slowly improving)

job_title: GE LAB TECH in Fairfax, VA
pros: There are no pros ....
cons:
I started this position by cleaning the endo scopes(which was NOT described in their employment ad).
The wash room has toxic fumes, it gets too hot in the wash room, there is NO ventilation in the wash room, the sinks are too LOW you end up hurting your neck and back due to the sinks position.

Also, there were certain coworkers who weren't taking the proper steps in cleaning the scopes. I questioned some things to make sure I wasn't misunderstanding. Then I read the manuals. (I have a background in OSHA ) Then, I brought a couple things up to the manager because I was confused on how to proceed. This coworker then lied. I was then made to feel like I WAS A PROBLEM. I felt like I was in the Twilight Zone. I was then bullied from then on out by this coworker and shunned by a few others because of said coworker.
I was told by manager that they have not had any issues up until now. WOW.

Besides that, I ended up hurting my cervical and lumbar spine because of the wash room sinks. I was out on Short term disability then let go RIGHT BEFORE I would become eligible for Long term Disability.

job_title: Anonymous in Fairfax, VA

For those in the know, this will lead to very bad bad things down the line. Administration's fault. They want money, vanity, and public attention only.

Nursing staff are treated like garbage, doctors treat staff and patients how they please with no repercussions. 
Directors are just cannon-fodder so upper management can avoid penalties.

Anesthesia techs consistently do not receive training. This has led to multiple horrendously avoidable mistakes in the ORs. (Need I remind anyone of Alex Smith, the QB that visited here)

Its a rich peoples club disguised as a hospital system.

job_title: Credentialing Specialist in Falls Church, VA
pros:
My team was absolutely amazing to work with. I honestly think I struck gold with my co-workers, supervisor, and manager.

You get a LOT of experience talking with and writing to providers in this role.

We were able to work remotely for COVID-19 and were supplied with technical equipment this spring.

Benefits (medical/dental/PTO/etc) were pretty decent.

It's also nice knowing that you are helping the health system overall with what you do every day.

I wouldn't discourage someone from working at Inova - there are worse places and better places to be, and it's not my place to tell someone what to do. I do not regret working at Inova, but there were just some negative points that I grew tired with.
cons:
The pay is relatively low, but not far from (if not at the same level) the average salary for most starting credentialing roles.

The technical equipment that we were given is incredibly outdated and took up a fair bit of space. A laptop (with all proper security measures of course) would have been a much simpler solution.

You constantly feel like the non-clinical roles (except for maybe C-suite and high level execs) weren't really appreciated. Sometimes it's a thankless job.

For the department there wasn't much opportunity for growth, meaning many would switch departments or leave the company entirely.

job_title: RN Unit Supervisor in Fairfax, VA
pros: Great learning opportunities for new grads. Organized clinical setting especially Inova Fairoaks hosp. Lots of kind and hardworking nurses and techs.
cons:
Inova pays terrible for experienced nurses. Cost of living us very high in Nova, but they totally ignore that.
Management decided a smart thing to do is create a system float pool solution to sfaffing problems. Float pool staff are paid $47+ /hr for doing the exact same thing in house employees are doing. Of course these nurses deserved to be paid that much. We work very hard. But that move dove out all the experienced nurses that were desperate for years for a decent pay to an internal travelling crap system. No real committment. Just show up, take care of yoir patients and leave. You get paid well for doing just that. Now the units are understaffed, filled with new grads that are paid crap like $25, for working so hard. Units management struggling to have internal staff take up responsibilty to run units smoothly. All the experienced nurses are running arounding from
Hospital to hospital with fully utilizing their talents other than direct patient care.

If you have a family emergency....well good luck trying to find coverage.  Poor, poor, pay.  PRN for 10 years and not a penny raise.  No benefits, no vacation pay, no sick pay. Everyone is walking on pins and needles waiting for the next blow to staffing.  How they got Magnet Status is beyond me.  Senior management is out of touch with what is really happening on the floors. job_title: ICU RN in Tysons Corner
pros:
I worked at INOVA Fairfax for 4.5 yrs and started as a new graduate in the ICU fellowship.  I will say that their fellowship program for new graduate nurses was great and prepared me to become a competent ICU nurse.
You a large variety of patients in all the ICUs. Patients fly in from WV and MD to recieve specialized care. 
Aetna provides the benefits which are quite good
cons:
There is extremely high turn over in managers (3-8months). With no managers there is no one to escalate problems on the floor to. 
Patients that should be 1-1 in the ICU (CRRT, Traumas, TPA patients)  are being paired  and jeopardizing patient safety.
 Falls are at an all time high in the past 6months related to short staffing
Staff turn over is high in the ICUs for various reasons,but new graduate nurses are being hired in bulk in the ICU and are not recieving the proper training from experienced veteran nurses which is resulting in more mistakes, poor attention to detail and med errors
With the increased Cost of Living in the northern VA/DC area, INOVA has not given their employees a SUBSTANTIAL raise in the time i worked there to keep up with the growing area.
Your 1x bonus per year is based off of the HCAPs score in your area(ie: womens and childrens, the medical tower, and heart and vascular dept) not off your own individual or Unit performance.
Staff morale across the hospital is low, the happiest people seem to be environmental service team

Recently we had a major flood on our unit and the entire floor is now closed until further notice at the minimum 2 weeks but probably longer.  There are now 150 staff without work and without a paycheck.  We are being forced to take our earned vacation time, which with the few hours we get every pay period it take a long time to accrue a week of leave. We also have the option to take leave without pay, isn’t that a great offer.  They told us they wanted us to be at work and would find us things to do.  There are 17 people scheduled and their offer is 2 people can be greeters the rest have to stay home.  We are being punished for something out of our control.  There are staff members worried about how they are going to feed their family, pay their mortgage, pay their bills while the shirt and ties sit in their offices and get paid.  I will be using my time off wisely and look for another job where they do value good nurses and support staff.  I am hoping that many of my colleagues join me

job_title: Clinical Technician in Alexandria, VA
pros: We have benefits. It's a good first job in healthcare.
cons:
-Inova does not pay employees enough to live in the area.  75% of my monthly income is equal to a cheap 2 bedroom apartment in the surrounding 4 counties. That is not feasible for a one income family. This forces a majority of techs AND nurses to look for a 2nd job on their days off.
 -The health insurance is ok...but I still get alot of bills, my biggest one's have been from emergency room visits to Inova facilities.
- There is favoritism when people do or don't get write ups. The rules don't apply evenly to everyone.  
-Your paid time off (PTO) is sick and vacation lumped together. You have to accrue PTO hours (5 per pay period) in order to use them. 
-The call out policy has gotten stricter throughout the years and they don't care if you or your dependents are sick. 3 call outs in a year and you will get a warning, 4 and you get written up. This is pretty unfair considering we work with SICK people.  
-As a tech there is no room for growth.
- Security is worthless. There are very few officers that are helpful and capable of doing their job. If there is ever an emergency we do not have back up.

pros:
* Fast paced environment. Many challenges. Rapid expansion.

cons:
* The IT department at Inova is currently undergoing major upheavals. A large percentage of the "old timers" have been displaced over the last 18 months and replaced with contractors. * Raises are often a token gesture (a 0.5% increase  one year after several years with no increases.)

* The company has perhaps expanded too quickly over the last decade and may be vulnerable to a downturn in the local economy.

The hospital tries to do the right thing by providing and documenting the training that they are required to have. cons: Toward the end of my 8-10 year career in Human Resources with Inova Fairfax Hospital I was burned out.  I think that combined with turnover in HR staff and leadership - the end of this adventure was inevitable in a way. job_title: Analyst in Fairfax, VA
pros:
It's a big enough system that you can move around with ease and work with the best people you know.   

They worked really hard to finally pay fair market competitive pay for their clinical staff.
cons:
The politicking is really bad. Working with various levels of leadership, one soon realizes that there are a lot of games being played here and some leaders get to their positions by essentially throwing people under the bus so they can look good.   There is a severe disconnect between the executives and the department employees that is filtered by directors and senior directors  that often look out for their own interest.  

A whole department can quit and the leader that caused it would be moved laterally and not demoted or even fired.   I am surprised this company has not been sued yet for workplace bullying or something. 

Why do only clinical staff warrant fair market pay salary review?  Administrative, clerical staff ...well dont hold your breath, you might never get paid a competitive salary.

job_title: Management Coordinator in Falls Church, VA
pros: Convenience of location, and the benefits package is good.
cons: As it seems to be with many health care organizations, the management environment is extremely 'cliquey' and the potential for growth seems to be more about whom you know or how well you tow the party line versus what positive impact you can make for the patients, the hospital or the organization. While they say out of the box thinking is welcomed and appreciated, I found over the course of 4 years, that this was not true. This does vary from hospital to hospital, but overall - INOVA's management and Human Resources departments leave alot to be desired, and Mr. Singleton, no matter how many times he's heard these complaints, seems to do nothing about changing the environment.

review_title: This company is really Terrible ! Management Is Terrible too!
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Leesburg, VA
pros: I have No pros to write down.
cons: Pay dose not come anything near the amount of work that  CNA are required to do. Good workers pay the price for Bad workers. State needs to visit more often and interview all residents and employees. Management here are really good at Lying but especial when they are are under screwing.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fairfax, VA
pros: After a venture capital was formed they kept the Inova name even though it’s not the INOVA Health systems associated with area hospitals and other medical orgs in the area. It’s really misleading but as employees our patients are often more open to us because of the name.
cons: The INOVA Home Health was part of the INOVA Health systems but in September they formed a Venture Capital with ASHN. We are no longer employees of Inova. We lost significantly in benefits and pay and ASHN manages from Ohio. I never seen management that were so cold and unresponsive to employees. They don’t answer questions, they make statements and then deny it. They always take and never give. Even former management who stayed on who used to be helpful seem to be not allowed to respond without Ohio’s permission. Very sad for employees. Morale is poor and getting worse. They made some assumptions about what they could do taking over without knowing the No. Va area that others could have told them but they refused to listen. Now they just push harder on employees to make a profit.

review_title: The ship has sprung a leak
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Falls Church, VA
pros:
Great co-workers--at least in the Cardiac division
Willing to spend money on medical technology
Decent non-financial benefits such as vacation time and time off for bereavement
cons:
Bottom-line thinking is the driving force now. It used to be a great place to work at, but money is now their focus.
Executive level managers are making bad short term decisions that will have long term impacts on reimbursements. 
Protected bedside nursing staff in the last layoff at the expense of their support people.
Productivity is compared to non-teaching hospitals
Wages for long term employees have been frozen for years
"Bonus" pay is tied to results staff have little control over

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Fairfax, VA
pros:
You get to work for a Non-Profit.  
Your own satisfaction out of helping patients, when you're allowed and it doesn't interfere with patient satisfaction.
Depending on which unit you're in, you may be lucky to work with people who help each other.
cons:
Most units don't help each other out.  Most managers are more concerned about patient satisfaction then about patient welfare.
They are not concerned about paying their staff well, and would rather pull in more expensive outside resources for a short time, then pay their core staff what they should.
The medical benefits are not quite what you would expect when working for a hospital.

review_title: ICU New Grad Bullying at its finest
job_title: RN in Alexandria, VA
pros: Multiple locations I guess
cons: The term"nurses eat their young" holds true here. I have never been met with so much lateral bullying in my life. ICU is tough, but not impossible as a new grad with the right support. if you are willing to hire new grads in the ICU AT LEAST pair them with a preceptor WILLING to teach them instead of converse with their friends all day and scoffing at the idea of them hiring you as a new grad ADN in the ICU because they had to work Med Surg for 2 years after their BSN, before coming to the ICU.  Why would you have someone precept a new grad/new hire with this mindset?  Do you really expect them to provide the best learning experience without bias? Horrible experience as a first job out of nursing school.  Once the "group" decides they don't like you they will make your experience miserable and suggest you "resign" bullying you until you leave. I was so excited to work here and left disappointed. Definitely not welcoming.

job_title: IT Engineer in Falls Church, VA
pros:
Not many 
401k match is decent
cons:
Pay
Micro management 
HR dept.
Company culture

review_title: Inova pays employees very little and the bureaucracy has made getting even the simplest of tasks accomplished difficult.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Falls Church, VA
pros: They provide (okay) Health Coverage.
cons: Said Health Coverage is moving to Inova-owned insurance, meaning the employer provides health insurance and health service (expensive to go outside of Inova). There is worry among employees they will force us to get annual health screenings and raise our premiums accordingly. This is dangerous territory for an employee. They DO NOT pay competitive wages and forbid the formation of unions. Once you are an employee you are going to be stuck at your wage for a very long time. Even with a promotion, they always find a way or policy to prevent you from making the same wage they would hire a new person at. So basically, it's easier to get a raise or paid for a promotion by quitting your job and being rehired than it is by actually staying with the company.  HR does not do their job and are just the puppets of the administration. Inova also make the most basic of tasks extremely complicated and time consuming.

job_title: in Fairfax, VA
pros: Large company, well known in the area
cons: Managers are not held accountable for high turnover in their dept. Human Resources does not enforce companies policies as the should(some do not even know what policies exist and how to find them!), but allow managers that the support to do as they see fit. Executive level staff does nothing about formal grievances that are placed about unfair treatment or wrong behavior of managers. No full investigations are ever done when these compliments are filed. They refuse to acknowledge that there is a problem with bad management in this organization. Instead, the employee suffers and either resigns or manager decides to devise ways to terminate the employee. Bad managers continue to exist and the cycle continues with the next victim.

job_title: Analyst in Falls Church, VA
pros:
Public reputation still good 
 Continues to be financially sound
Lots of room to be better. 
The Board is very empowered.
cons: Lack of respect for people with knowledge . New CIO has some knowledge about security and infrastructure, but her experience with care of patients, hospital operations, and the ability to create teams is severely lacking. There are many closed door meetings with a culture of secrecy that is toxic. People are always afraid to speak or ask questions, for fear their jobs are at stake. Many good employees are leaving and saying it is because of a hostile environment.

review_title: Inova does not value their employees
job_title: Clinical Manager in Fairfax, VA
pros: Despite being overworked and underpaid, co-workers seemed committed to quality patient care. However, there is frequent turnover among staff for the aforementioned reasons.
cons:
Senior leadership is detached, unaware of what is happening in the gemba. 
The organization got too lean several years back and is now scrambling to recover. 
Pay is abysmal, non competitive, and well below grade for the DC area. 
The benefits package offered through Aetna Innovation is more expensive and provides less coverage for their own Inova employees versus other groups. Example, my husband works for Fairfax County Public Schools and we get Inova owned Aetna Innovations high family coverage through FCPS - overall cost is lower, and benefits (percentages out of pocket and deductibles, copays, etc.) are better. This is an area where Inova should be very embarrassed that as the largest healthcare system in NoVa., they are not taking care of their own employees.

review_title: Not a company for longterm employment
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Falls Church, VA
pros: Inova still has a great reputation in the DMV area for care received, and having them on a resume is a positive thing.  There is almost always an opportunity for overtime due to the constant need to fill staffing grids.
cons: Inova pays on the low side of the average for the DMV area, and the staffing on almost every unit is always in dire straits due to a high turnover rate and poor management of staffing levels.  They can't keep management in place long enough to effect change due to the combination of their unrealistic expectations and low compensation.  The executive end of the company is more concerned with acquiring holdings rather than retaining and rewarding employees for their hard work and loyalty to the patients and the company.

job_title: Clinical Director in Falls Church, VA
pros: Most of the nurses and staff are very good at their jobs and leave because they are and are very marketable.
cons: The leadership does not respect or appreciate the nursing staff or understand that patients are admitted for NURSING care. The doctors admit patients for NURSING care. They disrespect nursing and clinical staff and try to underpay them and then wonder why they cannot retain staff.

review_title: It Is Anything But "The Future of Health"
job_title: Director in Falls Church, VA
pros: many smart, kind people who want to deliver quality healthcare; good pay; and the potential for much needed transformation with an upcoming change in leadership
cons: minimal exposure to leading edge thinking and practice (which will not position people for future job prospects), no innovation and many factors working against it, little opportunity for impact (as slow, dysfunctional and incompetent decision making is a barrier), no meaningfulness (the only criterion seems to be "how much money can we make"), lackluster benefits, and an HR function that can be described as nothing more than an embarrassment

job_title: Accounts Payable in Falls Church, VA
pros: Great location, nice eatery/cafe in building.  Security officers on staff in the building.  Parking garage with plenty of spaces.
cons: More favoritism than you will believe.  Management had some personal tragedies and seems to be taking it out on the staff.  Management  is very unpredictable.  Management chose their best friend who worked in a department that has nothing to do with AP to be the a manager instead of promoting the person within the department who is more than capable and ran the department smoothly while management  was out dealing with their tragedy.  The best friend's immediate family member who also works in the department is supposed to be reporting to the best friend.  It's a mess there.  All but one person in the AR department resigned because it's such an awful environment to work in...very, very tense.

job_title: Administrative Coordinator in Leesburg, VA
pros: You receive 7 paid holidays.
cons: High turnover rate due to a toxic work environment. They give recognition toward nurses more than anyone else. The pay is low for administrative coordinators. Directors show favoritism toward employees. These employees are allowed to do as they please without any discipline while other employees are expected to pick up the slack. They will cover up time fraud and reward those employees with promotions and raises. Employees are scared to report to HR due to the fact they will use it against them later. Your personal information is not confidential and spoken about to all employees. Lastly, after being trained to take over for someone when they retire, they will not allow you to take the position if they had to make a temporary accommodation for you because of your disability. If your director and HR want you out of the company but have no grounds to fire you, they will make you feel uncomfortable until you leave. You will walk around on egg shells.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Falls Church, VA
pros: The only reason I have continued to work at Fairfax is because my colleagues are great people.
cons:
Poor organizational structure. Definitely a bureaucratic institution specifically with their Bed Management/Operations Center, a unit where beds are assigned in an inefficient process and patient's suffer needlessly because of ineptitude. It worked more efficienctly when bed assignments were made with the unit charge nurse. This organization re-structures every 2-3 years only to cause upheaval and to thin management.  However, upper management and C levels continue to increase positions. Upper management continues to focus on short-term financial goals and not the long-term. This makes for a hostile environment and one where problems are not addressed based upon what will work over an extended period.



Treats staff poorly. If someone disagrees with a manager/physician regarding an issue, the person who complained is treated poorly. The organization routinely aligns with physicians regardless of the safety issue.

job_title: Front Line Manager in Fairfax, VA
pros: Lots of variety and opportunity to grow in this company.  If you have a good leadership and are a hard worker, you can get recognized and promoted.  Benefits are fine and environment at the hospitals is good - usually people are in healthcare because they care about people.
cons: Inova is a big company and it takes a long time to make changes/get things done.  Lots of strategic initiatives in all the service lines and not good direction/prioritization for the limited resources.  Clinical services always growing, but back office support is not and the tools are cumbersome or manual so it's hard to keep up with support the clinical growth.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fairfax, VA
pros: Good, supportive coworkers. Coming to work is enjoyable. Top notch docs in msicu. Decent benefits.
cons: Underpaid, unsupported beside nurses. Out of touch management. Nurses leave too often for better pay and/or masters programs because they're tired of exhausting bedside care.

job_title: Medical Director Employee Health in Falls Church, VA
pros: HR is vey fair with  their employees. They bend over backwards to follow Reasonable Accomodations for employees with medical issues. They offer lots of training to employees at several levels. Good feedback loops are in place to allow HR to learn how management is being perceived. Their attention to detail in patient care is unparalleled in being meticulous, ongoing, under review and open to suggestion. Makes you proud to be on their team.
cons: The Affordable Care Act has forced them to downsize and "do more with less" to allow the Inova System not to go into the red.  This has meant waves of layoffs for folks doing a good job

job_title: Power Plant Operator in Mount Vernon, VA
pros:
I had the pleasure to work with a great group of professionals in the power plant and up in the hospital. The power plant lead operator and shift operators do a great job keeping the plant clean and equipment up to date, online and patents comfortable.
Engineering management tried to accommodate the employees as much as possible. 
The hospital engineers are on task maintaining equipment and working hard to keeping patents comfortable.
cons:
I did not like being charged lunch when I could not leave the site on my time and it spells out in company policy that if you work through lunch then you are not charged.
During the transition from ABM back to Inova I did not like having my job position  posted.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fairfax, VA
pros: Coworkers are great, compensation is ok...on the level with other hospitals. We take pride in our work and in our hospital (Inova Fair Oaks).
cons: Nurses Week was a joke and a slap in the face. Asked to bake cookies for other departments to show our appreciation -- hello, where's the appreciation for us? This would be like my child asking me to make him breakfast in bed for Mothers Day! Oh, we also had the opportunity to bring in a casserole for a potluck lunch, and admin brought around a tea cart with Entenmanns snacks, but only stopped at the main nurses station, didn't even bother actually coming to the other nurses stations where nurses were actually working. Not even the customary "thank you nurses" banner in the lobby. I know money is tight, but a heartfelt thank you would have been nice...

job_title: Scheduling/Registration Representative II in Falls Church, VA
pros: Call-center is easy. Once you get the epic system down and find your groove multitasking, you'll be set. When it's busy, you'll be answering about 130+ calls a day. On a slow day, you could be sitting there for 20 minutes with no calls. Very easy.  Easy-going patients make it very fun. Great health benefits
cons: This same position has two locations: call center or front desk at the actual primary care office. Same pay. Working the front desk will give you 2-3x the workload and none of the upgrade in pay. You'll be making as much as the people sitting in the call center. Also patients will range from angry to extremely pissed off.

job_title: RN III in Alexandria, VA
pros: Close to home, easy commute for me
cons: Clinical staff (nurses and techs) are not valued by management. Employees are essentially warm bodies that can get tasks done. Very frequently short staffed with little or no effort to improve this problem. Upper level management will occasionally breeze through the department with some sort of "treat" (ice cream sandwiches) in an attempt to improve morale which the majority of us find insulting to our intelligence. Lots of bureaucracy and red tape, very little thinking outside of the box. Pay is woefully low considering the cost of living in this area. Upper level administration makes exorbitant salaries/bonuses and for what? Nauseating culture of using and abusing nurses while the 9-5'ers keep their heads buried in the sand as they cash their six figure checks. Wake up Inova, you would not exist if it weren't for the nurses that provide the care for the masses.

review_title: Fast paced, outcomes oriented, focused on reputation and awards not employees
job_title: Manager in Falls Church, VA
pros: Staff are committed to providing excellence in patient care delivery and being knowledgeable regarding latest treatment and procedure and treatment modalities.  Recognized nationally for various medical specialities.
cons: Punitive work environment for failure to meet desired metrics, communication between corporate and senior leadership and middle management and staff guarded with little transparency, lack of trust throughout the organization. Pay and benefits mid range with no increase in salary for senior staff.  Professional education available however limited funding for external professional education and or education towards the advanced degrees.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Falls Church, VA
pros: Health and Exercise Classes; discounted. Some amazing Physicians and Nurses
cons: Their HR Division is beyond broken. Every year a new group of leaders come in with 'amazing' new ideas and they are all fired by the end of the year. I can't imagine working in this chaos. The Director never responds to emails, never has yet somehow continues to get promoted. The great HR staff leave, the very low performers of course stay. There is not one thing that works. You are bounced around from person to person to get an answer on just about anything. Recruitment is a nightmare. Potential employees/applicants never get called back and most directors/managers are simply forced to bypass their systems to get anything accomplished. How the board has not investigated this group; we will never know.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Alexandria, VA
pros: Most of the staff is super nice. People always greet you warmly when you walk in the hallways of the hospital and you see they really mean it. I have also been very impressed with the new RN program training. Everything has been so organized and to the point and the staff really cares about their new employees' learning and development. They treat all their contract employees as their own employees and I have felt the support. Finally, just a very nice atmosphere.
cons: The pay could be a lot better. Virginia area is too expensive for the amount we get paid. However, they do offer opportunities for bonuses and there is a better amount of differential pay after certain hours.

review_title: I spent my entire nursing career of 32 years at INOVA Fairfax making a difference at the patient's bedside.
job_title: Clinical Case Management in Falls Church, VA
pros: I loved coming to work daily because I sensed I was valued as a team member to care for the patients I was assigned to daily.  I was heard and respected for my experience and knowledge and participated in many unit, hospital and system wide committees to make positive change.
cons: Some changes lately impacted on the more experienced, longevity, and higher paid staff that gave a feeling of being devalued.

job_title: Registered Nurse II in Fairfax, VA
pros: The on-boarding training for RNs is very thorough. It's like going back to school, there are online and live classes, sim labs and other resources available. If you've been away from acute care and afraid to come back because you're not too confident anymore, INOVA is the best place to start. They treat you like family. Everybody is concerned about you being comfortable and confident with your new job and that you know what to do to safely care for your patients! The managers and educators are available to answer whatever questions you may have! I'm confident to say, I made the right choice!
cons: Parking. It's so hard to find parking in the employee garage. And the IFMC is HUGE so you can get lost around it, but just ask and every person is always willing to point you to the right direction.

job_title: Outpatient Registrar in Alexandria, VA
pros: Some of the best reasons to work in my particular dept.which is the patient registration at the Healthplex, is the ability to have a flexible schedule.  They work around your school schedule like no place I've ever been to.  Another good reason is the tuition reimbursement of $ 3000 yearly for full time employees.  There's also discounts for small fee that gets taken off your paycheck for lawyer's fees, medical pet care, financial advise, Inova classes, etc.
cons: At the place where I work( I am sure it varies)  it's hard to advance.  They also do not give you any feedbacks on your work.  Health insurance is pretty expensive for a family of 3 an insurance that pays at 10% coinsurance and no yearly deductible comes up to about  $ 500 a month.

job_title: RN NICU in Falls Church, VA
pros: I used to be proud to be a part of a reputable system with a strong comunity focus.  That has completely dissolved.
cons: The greed and corruption within this system has taken over.  All the executives are concerned about is making as much profit as possible to buy another facility or practice in their effort to monopolize northern virginia.  This is at the expense of the safety of patients.  They have made it a practice to only hire new graduate nurses or those with minimal experience and paay them rediculous salaries.  We have also brought in "international nurses" that do not even speak english to save money.  It is criminal!  Please if you have a loved one in IFH bring an advocate.  The safety of our community is absolutely not in the best hands there anymore

review_title: The current leadership is ruining what used to be an excellent hospital.
job_title: (Former) Manager in Falls Church, VA
pros:
Reasonable benefits. 
Some very dedicated, hard-working employees.
cons: Most of the Inova Fairfax Hospital Senior Leaders are overpaid, cold-hearted individuals who are relatively new and simply don't care about the organization. This is so obvious with every decision they make. The morale among the staff and middle management is so low yet Administration is oblivious to the mess they have created. There is so much dysfunction. The CEO rules by intimidating and treating others with no respect. Excellent people have been displaced from their jobs with little care by the leaders who forced these ridiculous changes. I feel sorry for the patients who are the ones who will ultimately suffer due to the actions of a few individuals who care about no one but themselves.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Alexandria, VA
pros: I work on a medical surgical unit and it gets busy but our supervisors make sure we typically get 5 patients max, 6 patients if there's no other option but that rarely has happened to me. They do everything they can to make sure we are doing okay, if we are satisfied with the job, chances for improvement, education opportunities. I really enjoy working here. This is my first RN job and I feel like they always work with you and support you. I have other nursing friends that went got hired by other hospitals but left already because it was too overwhelming, patient ratio was too high, and always short on nurses.
cons: The only con I have is that they expect you to be done with shift report by 1930 which is very unrealistic.

review_title: Too many layers and not enough communication....salary not competitive.
job_title: Human Resources in Fairfax, VA
pros: The benefits are very comprehensive and there are several locations within the organization where you can change career focus within the company and stay in the N. Virginia area.
cons: Because of the layered structure of the organization, it often takes the executive leadership too long to identify management problems at the mid-level. Too often when a tactical level employee has a valid concern that their direct manager dismisses, the problem has to become much larger before it is address. That means there are various teams at throughout the organization that must tolerate poor mid-level managers while the executive team in not accessible and therefore unaware of the problems.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fairfax, VA
pros: Teamwork, great dedicated coworkers, safe patient ratios, culture dedicated to patient safety and strong outcomes
cons: Leadership at system level; lack of communication and a system still stuck in working in silos

review_title: Hospital with great potential but miles to go
job_title: Emergency Department RN in Falls Church, VA
pros: Such a great reputation with patients and great track record.  All the pieces to be able to compete with the nearby world class hospitals.
cons: Refuses to put the time/money into their employees to improve staffing ratios/conditions/equipment/etc so that current staff will stay, safety will improve and the hospital can reach its full potential.  Such a shame because so much time/money is put into training new hires at the start and it ends up being a waste because hardly anyone stays for more than a couple years.

review_title: It is a place that recognizes nursing as a profession
job_title: Staff Nurse in Falls Church, VA
pros: comitted to patient safety and dedicated to making a patient visit as good as possible from the time of entering the door.
cons: although it is a Magnet hospital, it does not regularly allow policy to be nurse driven and therefore there is a level of dis-satisfaction among nurses about their role in "shared leadership"

job_title: Cath/EP Lab Tech in Fairfax, VA
pros: I enjoyed working within my immediate department. I was always able to get the time off that I needed, the pay was decent, good benefits too. I felt like I was doing something that mattered.
cons: Largest problem by far was how out of touch upper management seemed. Each year a new initiative would be undertaken by the hospital and pushed onto the staff. There was never buy-in at the lowest level, and it led to a lot of turnover. Our own department head was extremely out of touch and jumped ship as soon as he finished grad school for a better job.

review_title: Poor management, excellent benefits with fair pay
job_title: Registered Nurse in Fairfax, VA
pros: The benefit package with Inova is great.  Hourly pay is fair, not fabulous - but fair.  In theory - the fellowships they offer for Nursing are great - however, what is promised with a fellowship is not necessarily what happens once you sign on.
cons:
Management is not great, at best.  Communication between management teams is lacking.  Understaffed floors have burned out nurses ( who have been constantly training new hires ) leaving the experienced nurses on the floors frustrated and with a lack of patience for new grads or new hires who are changing specialties and require extensive training in their new, chosen field.
Patient care can suffer, staff is exhausted and overworked and promises made at the time of hire are not met.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Alexandria, VA
pros: Co-workers are wonderful, helpful, and overall great to work with
cons:
Salary- extremely low compared to cost of living for this area
Management- Will pretend to care about staff but will then turn around and stab you in the back
Overall system- all about the money, no matter how hard you work at the end of the day they will show their true colors.

job_title: Senior Cloud Engineer in Falls Church, VA
pros:
This review is for the Inova Translational Medicine Institute (ITMI)
- Not much going on, its a "keep the lights on" type of job for IT folks.
- New work area will be really nice, across from the Fairfax Hospital.
cons:
- If you like to move your career forward by dealing with new technologies and feel you are pushing your knowledge, this is not the place.
- There is a merge happening with the main hospital's IT department therefor its not even sure what jobs will stay and which will be gone.
- Lots of planning but very little doing (this can be a pro for some people).
- Management on the IT side.
- Eventually trust in management will be lost when you see nothing really happening.

job_title: Blood Donor Specialist in Sterling, VA
pros: INOVA definitely offers good employee benefits, such as retirement, life insurance, employee assistance programs. It is a popular organization, with a growing popularity. Salary is fair.
cons: INOVA has a policy that declines any time off request if a department is understaffed, even if you've maxed out on PTO. I was hired as a part time employee for blood donor services, yet I was scheduled full time. My manager never approved a single time off request of mine, and always scheduled me for shifts that were the least convenient or that would conflict with my personal life.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Leesburg, VA
pros: The culture of the company is that of treating the employees well, as they provide consistent, competent care.  Every interaction with a patient should be positive.  People are happy to be at work.
cons: This was the best hospital environment I have been in.  I experienced the hospital from the perspective of the patient before I sought employment.  I got a job here specifically because of the vastly different atmosphere I felt from other hospitals I've worked in.  Employees were invested in the company, in each other, and most importantly in their patients.

review_title: Employment at IFH is one where you will spend your entire time there looking for another job.
job_title: Clinical Research Associate in Fairfax, VA
pros: They pay you well for clinical research.
cons: Culture of mediocrity. Administration is very content with no work or progress done but just attending meetings and acting busy. No one in research management has specific research experience to give them that title.  All doctors act entitled to research services but want to do no work. There are zero cancer treatment protocols, but they advertise as if there are many cancer treatment trials to get on. The only people who work there for a long time are those that can find a job elsewhere or are too incompetent to figure out how to leave.

review_title: Inova is the lowest paying Healthcare organization in Northern Virginia
job_title: RN3 in Fairfax, VA
pros: Hired into day shift position no night requirements  and don't have to take call. Great co workers. Great doctors.  Great support staff.
cons: Pay!!!! We haven't received a significant pay increase or cost of living in the past 5+ years but our insurance costs have increased.  Last year I received $0.03/HR increase and the year before $0.08/HR.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Falls Church, VA
pros: Good benefits such as backup daycare and decent PTO also insurance.
cons:
-non profit organization that’s ran as a corporation. Everything is about bottom line since manager level and above are paid based in that.
-Very low retention rate since the good ones are treated bad and so only the bad ones  stay
- Rather hire external people with no healthcare experience than internal promotion.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Fairfax, VA
pros: Its a learning experience. Coming from a small hospital to this one, you learn a lot about different procedures and medications that you would not normally see in a smaller hospital setting.
cons: Its a horrible environment. Never had so much drama and stress in my life until I started working here. If there is drama and you’re the new person on the block, your voice will not be heard and no one will believe anything you say. If coworkers don’t like you for any reason at all, they will find a way to make your life miserable or get you out of that hospital. Nurse hazing in every department in this hospital is alive and well.

review_title: Bad Benefits bad management No communication
job_title: IT Tech in Fairfax, VA
pros: The non management staff are good people
cons: Management no communication very fake and two faced

job_title: Therapist in Alexandria, VA
pros: Patients are great, base salary is acceptable, intense busy workday (which is mostly good, but sometimes not the best for patients)
cons: Concerned only with profit and numbers despite fancy rhetoric to the contrary, top-heavy management, poor/no communication between managers and staff, problematic managers allowed to remain in their roles unchecked despite many complaints, inflexible schedules, terrible PTO policy, HR and onboarding process was riddled with errors and issues that caused significant problems for which Inova never took any responsibility and just tried to push under the rug.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fairfax, VA
pros: The incentives based on insurance and the convince of technology
cons: You are expected to work and produce but recieve little pay and when there is a need for upper management to be empathetic, it is almost non existent. All talk and no action. Concerns have been mentioned but fall by the wayside. It's their way or no way.

job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Fairfax, VA
pros: Decent pay. Big company. Looks good on paper; if only this held true for all circumstances. Medical benefits are good; discounts available for healthy activity.
cons: Department management is a joke; employer has zero respect for its employees. High turnover rates. Employer does not understand; but refuses to truly hear what employees have to say. Other departments may be better but be fair warned about department you are interviewing for. HR is impossible to deal with. No real people just phone numbers to route you back to e-mails that are never resolved.

job_title: Clinical Technician in Falls Church, VA
pros: pay is decent with vacation and time off
cons: It was a discouraging and negative unit that I worked on.  My experience working on the Oncology unit of Fairfax Medical Campus turned out negative and discouraging. The managers and workers on the unit were unsupportive, negatively judgmental, carried on non work related conversations in the overnight shifts, complained non-stop which aroused additional unneeded stress and pressure, and the managers did not provide a fair chance for colleague's concerns to be heard or implement changes. At one point, my gut feeling told me this is enough. I continued to feel pushed down working here. I will never recommend working on this unit to clinical technicians. Please try to work in a more positive unit of Inova, as Inova overall, is highly reputable and positive place to work and grow.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Alexandria, VA
pros:
Stable job, decent benefits.  Five hospitals to choose from.  Once inside the system it is easy to move around.   Fair pay and benefits.  Okay retirement package, eliminated pension plan in 2014 now %5 match 401k.   21 funds to choose in stock market, low commissions - so someone in the benefit department is making sure we don't get ripped off by Fidelity.   Not great, not bad.  Tuition assistance $5000 a year.  Some hospitals have on-site day-care, high price but good quality.  Free parking - unlike DC hospitals. 

Lots of opportunities to work overtime and make extra money, because people keep leaving.

During the 2008-2013 recession, I was grateful to have a job, watch several friends get laid off, but INOVA is stable and kept my job because I was a good employee,  my hospital did lay off some people during the recession as well, but glad they cleaned house and got rid of some bad apples. 

I gave two stars and still recommend, because INOVA has a monopoly on the area, it's hard to leave.
cons:
Grumpy doctors, unhappy managers.  Stressed out families and patients.  Surrounded by tragedy and sorrow all the time.  Employees come and go - the place is a revolving door.  This makes it difficult to feel connected, appreciated, and have meaningful work.  Dreaded going to work everyday.  I just went to work so I could pay my bills.  

Doctors have a lot of influence.  New ideas are not encouraged.  Managers like you if you don't complain, work like a dog, keep your head down, clock in and out, do your job and go home.  They don't want to hear what you have to say, and they don't want your ideas, just do what they day.  All of our meetings were information, directives to follow.  If you are a robot with no feelings this is a great place, but not a great place for patients - you have to be compassionate when working with patients, but management and co-workers are really not compassionate to each other and that trickles back down to the patients.

job_title: Clinical Technician in Falls Church, VA
pros: Full benefits with full time hours, work 3 days a week, extra hours are sometimes available. Few company events with free food.
cons: Patients come from other units/ER and later on find out is on precautions for possible infectious diseases. Management can be over worked and stressed, therefore trickles down on employees, doesn't treat employees like they are human and are not valued. Techs are always understaffed and overworked in a continuous cycle.

job_title: in Falls Church, VA
pros:
As a very large health system Inova easily provides a sense of supporting the community via a worth while industry.  At its basic level healthcare is a noble profession.
As an employer, Inova's sheer size provides opportunities that only large employers can provide.  For many disciplines, in healthcare as well as other non-healthcare specific fields Inova offers many opportunities.  These opportunities come in the actual diversity of daily work, projects and the number of advancement options.
cons: Current senior leadership has been in place for decades and by some measures much of the system’s success is attributed to that leadership.  However, true dysfunction exists at some levels within the system today – it is and has not been truly as healthy as it may seem from the outside.  All considered, one can not help but ask, what would the system look like today if a more effective leader had been a the helm over the last 5 or ten years?  In general, Inova leadership tends to operate in silos with rather poor corporate leadership. Efforts to improve middle management have been superficial at best; a waste of money (community resources) at worst.  In addition, regular turnover and executive reorganizations continue to frustrate leadership stability.   While opportunities exist one must consider the volume of work and the poor communication of leadership expectations.

job_title: Cardiac Tech in Fairfax, VA
pros:
"Powers that be" does best to, understandably, balance budget for expense vs. pay for workers (a challenge for a non profit)

Staff can be friendly (unless busy and stressed - some)
cons: Director is always nice and cooperative, Supervisor and other staff could do better (professionalism and fairness would be nice - although it is improving a little bit)

review_title: Nice people but heading in a shady direction.
job_title: Phlebotomist in Leesburg, VA
pros: Lots of friendly, talented people working here. Smaller hospital with more focus on patient care, happier patients overall.
cons:
Consistently understaffed, particularly on night shift. Managers couldn't figure out why they couldn't get anyone to work nights in our department -- maybe because it's too much work for one person to do without completely burning out?

Made a big show of holding meetings every year to talk about engagement surveys and suggestions for improvement, but nothing ever changed. Lots of favoritism. Supervisors who spend all day chatting instead of actually working.

Lots of people like to sit around and play on the internet ask day instead of actually working. Some of these people try to get as many hours as possible because they like the money, but they aren't actually helping the department at all. Managers like these people because they are willing to cover shifts that others won't, and turn a blind eye to their blatant laziness.

Laughable nonprofit. Workers are underpaid and forced to work in cramped environments while CEO rakes in millions. Bought sunflowers for everyone after laying off a bunch of staff. Lots of focus on expanding as much as possible while morale and quality suffers in already established units. PRNs haven't had a raise in more than a decade, with no pay difference based on experience -- a PRN with 5 years of experience makes less money than a new grad.

review_title: Being a PFS Supervisor at Inova is NOT all it's cracked up to be!
job_title: PFS Supervisor in Falls Church, VA
pros:
- Good health benefits
- Descent location (Telestar)
- Great leadership training
cons:
I was with Inova for 6 years and the latter part of my career there, I was promoted to PFS Supervisor; however, I had the absolute worst Director who was unsupportive, lacked consistent leadership abilities, and made the front line supervisors look like idiots mainly because she did not have our backs. 

The sad part is the the Sr. Director never saw any of this. She had rose colored glasses on to what was going on in the department. I could not handle one more day working with a director who acted so bipolar.... one day supervisors were getting praised for a job well done and the next, we were getting our heads chewed off for one reason or another. 

It was NOT a stable environment to be in. The AR staff could see the stress we were under and it really played an impact on them because of the high turnover rate. I wish the Sr. Director would have been more open to seeing what was going on and taken her head out of the Director's butt for one second and maybe she would have noticed how poorly her management team was and still is being treated so poorly by the Director she just absolutely adores.

Lastly, the hours we were expected to work (60+ in one week) were absolutely insane! That would drive anyone to the asylum!

job_title: IT Systems Engineer in Sterling, VA
pros: Overtime pay if you are a contractor is the only possible benefit at Inova Health System that I can think of.
cons: Age and race discriminatory and sexist boss. Expected to work during PTO (boss will text your personal phone). Harassed and humiliated. Severe favoritism. No career path. Anyone that speaks out of line/unfavorably of current procedure (as helpful criticism) is publicly humiliated and shunned. Company attitude is to avoid work wherever possible, not help customers, and shove work onto other employees and departments. Upper and lower management are like politicians in that they put on a good act, but behind closed doors they do the bare minimum to maintain their roles, push work onto inferiors (with way below average pay) and expect insane amount of work hours to be put in at all hours- through the nights, over holidays, birthdays, family illnesses, personal illness, etc. It goes on and on. The only way to succeed in this environment is to become a favorite or act as everyone else does and push your workload onto other people. If you actually want to help the customers you become REPRIMANDED and SHAMED for doing what is right. Customers are bitter and tired of IT's treatment and expect abuse from all IT departments and employees... with access and other functions going completely unaddressed and sub-par while hospital patients suffer the consequences. The new CIO/CISO, Consuelo "Connie" Pilot has mass-fired departments and employees while IT desperately needs to be re-infrastructured and managed and re-organized and motivated from the ground up. Employees get away with doing nothing, while others pick up an insane amount of the work, all the while, the customer, our own doctors and nurses and technicians suffer the greatest penalty. This is a despicable company and I would not be surprised to see Marshall Ruffin fire Consuelo Pilot very soon. Knox Singleton is a very distant and bad role model for the company. This is a non-profit that acts like a for-profit company with very eager and ruthless idiotic behavior.

In my research of pay between Northern Virginia and southern Virginia there is a minimal increase and the cost-of-living is almost triple what it is in the southern part portions of Virginia and it’s a state of the art hospital there’s money somewhere in I guess the Exxon station that they bought  Adjacent to the hospital to continue to expand and then understaffed and underpaid
